results.headline: Review: ‘The Cobbler,’ With Adam Sandler, a World in Others’ Shoes
results.summary_short: This Tom McCarthy film centers on a shoe repairman who can assume the appearance of his customers by donning their footwear.

results.headline: Review: In ‘Run All Night,’ Liam Neeson Sticks to What Works
results.summary_short: In yet another action film, Mr. Neeson plays a longtime underworld enforcer who goes on a killing spree to save his son’s life.

results.headline: Review: In ‘Home Sweet Hell,’ Married Life Isn’t Heaven

results.headline: Review: In ‘Cymbeline,’ a Drug Kingpin

results.headline: Review: In ‘Cinderella,’ Disney Polishes Its Glass Slippers
results.summary_short: Much of the fairy tale remains the same in the latest version, but the writer does add some dimensionality to the standard conception of the stepmother.

results.headline: Review: ‘3 Hearts,’ With Three Stars, by Benoît Jacquot

results.headline: Review: In ‘Of Horses and Men,’ the Animals Often Walk on Two Legs

results.headline: Review: Vladan Nikolic’s ‘Allure’ Shows New York Through Immigrants’ Eyes

results.headline: Review: In ‘Faults,’ Mind Games Don’t End Beyond the Cult

results.headline: Review: In ‘Buzzard,’ an Angry, Unkempt Antihero

results.headline: Review: ‘The Mafia Kills Only in Summer’ Is a Comical Look at the Mob

results.headline: Review: ‘Merchants of Doubt,’ Separating Science From Spin
results.summary_short: Robert Kenner’s documentary examines the history of corporate-financed public relations efforts to sow confusion and skepticism about scientific research.

results.headline: Review: ‘Kidnapping Mr. Heineken’ Revisits a 1983 Dutch Crime
